cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi SSE of Nassau, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest through the Bahamas, then bending north-northwest and skirting the Florida east coast toward Georgia and South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near the Florida east-coast shoreline between Cape Canaveral and Jacksonville

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Fernandina Beach FL to Edisto Beach SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Golden Beach FL northward to Fernandina Beach FL (entire Florida east coast including Jacksonville)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Deerfield Beach FL northward across the Florida east coast, Georgia coast and up to the Savannah River
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely and hurricane-force gusts are possible; 64-kt wind probability peaks near 16%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation of 5–8 ft above ground if peak surge coincides with high tide along the St. Johns River mouth and adjacent coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches with isolated amounts to 10 inches possible, leading to flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; possible river/tributary flooding from surge push.
